title: SUTRA-MS

body:
See 'Abstract': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Name The name of the item (model, framework, testbed, or tool). Format: Acronym (if relevant) - Expanded acronym or brief description:

SUTRA-MS

Version Version of the model or item, (for example, 2.0.0):

1.1

Description A description of the item. Instructions: Description includes its purpose or goals and the type of the model:

See 'Abstract': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Author/Developer The author(s) or developer(s) of this content:

Joseph D Hughes, Ward E Sanford

Contact Person Names of person(s) responsible for maintenance of the model along with their email:

Joseph D Hughes (jdhughes@usgs.gov), Ward E Sanford (wsanford@usgs.gov)

Release Date Date model was released (YYYYMMDD, YYYYMM, YYYY):

Last Update Date of last version update (YYYYMMDD, YYYYMM, YYYY):

201401

How to cite the model How to cite the model (for example, a Software Release citation (preferred) or a manuscript or report (if a code citation is not available)). For example, Doe, J.S., Sea Turtle Cuteness Model, 2020, U.S. Geological Survey, https://doi.org/xxxxx):

Organization Organization(s) that produced, funded, or partnered on the creation of this model:

U.S. Geological Survey

USGS Mission Area USGS Mission Area(s) the model originate(s) from. Not applicable for non-USGS models:

Water Resources

Identifier System identifier(s) for USGS systems like GitLab (code.usgs.gov), Pubs Warehouse, PIR tool, or identifiers for GitHub:

Programming Language Computer language or platform used for programming (for example, Fortran, R, Python):

Fortran-90

See 'Summary of Release': https://water.usgs.gov/nrp/gwsoftware/SutraMS/ReleaseNotes_SUTRA-MS_v1.1.pdf

License License for this content. Instructions: For USGS content, this is usually Public Domain or CC0-1.0:

Resources How to use the model, where to download it, manuals, user community pages, other webpages about the model (in other catalogs), USGS webpage) Model project page, Source code (organizational website or repository, if available):

Hughes, J.D., and Sanford, W.E., 2004, SUTRA-MS: A version of SUTRA modified to simulate heat and multiple-solute transport: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 2004-1207, https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207.

USGS Webpage: https://water.usgs.gov/nrp/gwsoftware/SutraMS/ReleaseNotes_SUTRA-MS_v1.1.pdf

References Where the model has been used: References to reports or publications where the model is used, or cited, outputs (data release), model archive, model application:

Keywords: Science keywords Topical science keywords that will help for discovering the item. Preferred to use terms from the USGS Thesaurus:

Keywords: Model type keywords Type of model, in the language common to the science discipline. examples: Process-based, Physics based, Empirical, Theoretical, Mechanistic, Numerical, Statistical, Geospatial):

Numerical

Keywords: Platform, mode, development status Platform: computing platforms a model will successfully run, e.g. Linux, PC, macOS (provide list, select one to many); Mode: command line, Jupyter Notebook, script, or graphical user interface (GUI); development status: (e.g., experimental, deployed, peer-reviewed):

Image An image to illustrate the item in the catalog. Instruction in form: URL for an image that best represents the model, title of image, alternate text, URL of source:

https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Related Catalog Items (Components, Parent Frameworks, Tools, Testbeds) Components (HasPart), Parent Framework (IsPartOf), Related Testbed (inTestbed?), or Related Tool (RelatedTool?), indicated by relationships, and displayed on the interface appropriately:

SUTRA

Requirements Software and/or hardware requirements needed to run the model and replicate any published results:

Dependencies All data dependencies needed to run the model and replicate any published results:

Installation information Information on how to install the model so that it can be run (e.g., compilation and/or execution instructions):

See 'Installation': https://water.usgs.gov/nrp/gwsoftware/SutraMS/ReleaseNotes_SUTRA-MS_v1.1.pdf

Assumptions Key assumptions made that define the dynamics of the model:

Model structure Provide a flow diagram of the model:

Equations and rules What are the equations and rules of the model?:

See 'Physical-Mathematical Basis of SUTRA-MS Modifications': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Temporal information Temporal resolution, time stepping, and units:

See 'Temporal Evaluation of Adsorbate Mass Balance': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Spatial information Spatial dimensionality, resolution, extent, grid type if relevant:

Limitations Limitations, domain ranges: What is this model specifically NOT intended to do:

Key input parameters Key input parameters and their values and domain ranges and units (minimum input requirements for model operation and default values, where appropriate):

See 'Input data': https://water.usgs.gov/nrp/gwsoftware/SutraMS/ReleaseNotes_SUTRA-MS_v1.1.pdf

See 'SUTRA-MS Data Input': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Key output variables Key output parameters and their values and domain ranges and units:

See 'Output data': https://water.usgs.gov/nrp/gwsoftware/SutraMS/ReleaseNotes_SUTRA-MS_v1.1.pdf![Screen_Shot_2021-02-17_at_1.36.31_PM](/uploads/f6df2ea0c073ce4a984fc0bdd44f20c7/Screen_Shot_2021-02-17_at_1.36.31_PM.png)

Sample input/output Provide links to sample input and output files, including run script, such as a cookbook or benchmark:

Initial conditions For example, starting points like the initial state of variables i.e. wind, temperatures, pressure, and moisture:

See 'SUTRA-MS Simulation Examples/ Initial Conditions': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Functions Forcing functions that affect the dynamics of the model:

Example Sample runs that illustrate the dynamics of the model:

See 'SUTRA-MS Simulation Examples': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Calibration Provide data used for calibration and evaluation of the model, if data are public:

Evaluation, uncertainty, sensitivity List of publications or links on evaluation, uncertainty, sensitivity analyses for your model:

See 'SUTRA-MS Simulation Examples/ Results': https://doi.org/10.3133/ofr20041207

Benchmarks Describe or provide benchmarks for validation of your model:

Usage and activity Metrics that can be obtained from repository API, such as repo commits:

Office of the Chief Operating Officer
